tn.ref: Go again, love a woman, loved by her husband, but who is an adulteress
tn.text: This refers back to [[:en:bible:notes:hos:01:01|1:2]]. Yahweh again tells Hosea to love an adulterous woman.

tn.ref: Love her just as I, Yahweh, love the people of Israel
tn.text: By loving the adulterous woman, Hosea will be an example of Yahweh's love for Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])

tn.ref: they turn to other gods and love raisin cakes
tn.text: People ate raisin or fig cakes during festivals where they worshiped false gods.

tn.ref: fifteen pieces of silver and a homer and a lethek of barley
tn.text: This was the price to buy a slave.
"a homer and a half of a homer" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])

tn.ref: For the people of Israel will live for many days without a king, prince, sacrifice, stone pillar, ephod or household idols
tn.text: Just as Hosea lived without his wife because she committed adultery, Israel will live without a king and without worshiping God, because they committed idolatry.
Here "seek" means they are asking God to accept them and their worship.
Here "David" represents all the descendants of David. AT: "a descendant of David to be their king" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "last days" refers to a period of time in the future. AT: "in the future" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: they will come trembling before Yahweh and his goodness
tn.text: Here "trembling" represents feelings of awe and humility. AT: "they will come back to Yahweh and will humble themselves, honor him, and ask for his blessings" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
